Subjective: Right eye irritation since Tuesday; redness, worse right > left; foreign body sensation; mild discomfort; left eye redness starting. No fever, cough, or shortness of breath. No trauma, discharge, or vision changes. Concern about infection/contagiousness. Request: Evaluate infection, consider antibiotics/drops.
Objective: Vitals: Not reported. Physical Exam: Redness right > left; no foreign body/discharge; pupils reactive; normal exam otherwise.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis, likely self-limiting. No signs of bacterial infection or other conditions (e.g., no pus, pain, or vision changes).
Plan: Artificial tears for comfort (available at Kruidvat)
Follow-up in 2 weeks if not improved or if symptoms worsen (e.g., pain, pus, vision changes)
No antibiotics needed unless bacterial infection develops
